Description: Gypsum footed bowl; low cylindrical dish with slightly flared rim and base and carved relief ridge at centre; foot widens to stepped disc at base; around one third of rim and upper body missing.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: See Bevan 2007 passim for an overview and typological guide to stone vessels of this kind and their use. The present example belongs to his Cyp1 group ('footed cup (tazza)) with other examples from Enkomi, Kalavasos-Mangia, Kition, Egypt as well as numerous unprovenanced pieces. Bibliography: Bevan A. 2007, Stone vessels and values in the Bronze Age Mediterranean (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press).
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P35, Fig 63)
